review: Came with my friends after a big competition because s were just craving Red Robin! We ordered a bunch of apps and entrees. The apps came out quickly and we had no complaints about the taste or temperature. Our entrees were mostly decent but the soups could use some work.  The reason for the 3 stars is because the service was a tad slow. One of our friends waited over 15 minutes for his drink refill. By the time his margarita arrived to our table you could tell it's been sitting out and the waitress probably forgot to bring it over. On top of that we had to flag down the waitress to get our refill on the bottomless fries. After ordering, we waited at least another 15 minutes for those to come out.  What made it all worth coming here? THE MILKSHAKES! Highly recommend grabbing one before you head out.

Today was disappointing and would sincerely be 1 or 2 stars, but I normally don't have an issue here. Our waitress went above and beyond so thanks to her I added the extra star.  Today was Tavern Burger Tuesday in which you get a free tavern burger of your choice ($6.99 value) with the purchase of another burger and two beverages. There were three of us and we ordered buffalo wings to start, two tavern burgers - one was the mac n cheese style, and a Royal burger. Also ordered a soda and 2 beers.  Wings came out, yummy as usual, but then there was this long wait for our burgers to arrive. Place wasn't jam packed, but it looked like our waitress was covering both the front and back of the house. Those who come here know it's not a tiny place so imagine this woman having to go back and forth all over. Our burgers finally came out and here's where it all went downhill. My mac n cheese tavern burger was cold, not warm, COLD, but the substituted fruit salad was fine. The mac n cheese felt like it was scooped out of a fridge container and placed on top. My mother's burger was cold and her fries were room temp. My father's Royal and fries were fine. I literally asked the waitress to please take her finger and feel this. She did and apologized profusely saying this is honestly cold and unacceptable. She removed both trays and we waited for our replacements. Twenty five minutes go by and now we are getting annoyed. My father already finished his meal and we were still waiting. The waitress noticed and came over again apologizing saying she will have the meals checked on and will talk to her manager. The burgers come back out and now mine is served with fries, not the fruit salad I substituted for more money and my mother's burger was identical in temp if not colder than before. Her fries were cold and mine were hot. The cheese actually rubberized on hers.  Before the waitress could even walk away my mother said she's done. Over it. The waitress apologized again and brought her out hot fries and we simply asked for the check. Waitress said she will have this rectified and came back to tell us our entire order was covered and nothing was due. We got up and heavily tipped the waitress as we weren't looking for a free ride here, we just wanted our food we ordered at a reasonable temperature and timely.  We never met the manager to thank her or voice our concerns, but our waitress was exceptional. I don't know if this was an off day or what have you, but we will wait a while to return to try again. (Table next to us had problem with their burgers too)  Overall we typically enjoy it here and service is always great. Sadly tonight was no bueno.

not worth it. Came in just before closing on a weekday and the restaurant itself wasn't busy. The service was slow and we kept having to remind the waiter to bring our drinks.  The burgers were just okay. Not worth the price paid.  The fries were soggy and tasted like they've been sitting out for a while.  The onion rings were better, but not by much.  With so many different burger joints now, it's not worth it to come here.

Stating adjacent for the evening at the LaQuinta  Came in for dinner before my son wanted to go into the pool You can walk through to the lobby  No need to walk far. Or outside  Open lunch and dinner  We ordered a Cobb salad  And a ordered hot donuts  My son got nachos and a kid meal of pepperoni pizza to go for school in the am Calvin was our server, very nice and pushed a lot of drinks and food  Pitched I'd say I just have a tiny stomach is all and I can't have alcohol I just had plastic surgery  So it's not a fun experience for me since I'm uncomfortable  There are a lot of kids here.  I want to blow my brains out.  Omg
An OK experience  I guess i had high expectations. I had heard about red robin burgers but did not find it to be great. The adult shakes were good.

My burger came out before the appetizer and was told my appetizer would be free and guess what it was not and I paid full price . I was told it was taken off my bill but there it is in all its glory on my bill. Will never be back !

Red Robin burgers have always been very good and I wasn't disappointed with the whiskey BBQ chicken wrap. However the garlic fries I was not impressed. Perhaps it was how they prepared it at this location, because I remember tasting one before off of my friends plate at another location and it seemed good. Anyways not worth the substitution cost.

I think this was the worst lunch I ever had in my life. My 2 year old son who is not picky at all literally spit out the first bite of his Cheeseburger and the fries were cold and he spit that out as well. My cheeseburger as well was burned and of low quality I took one bite and left it. The toppings were mushy and basically inedible. I ordered the fruit salad on the side which was not fresh and swimming in some of preservative based syrup. Hard to fathom. It also took forever and the place wasn't clean including the Ketchup bottle unfilled. I wouldn't eat here again if I was paid to do so.

Subpar service and food. Sat at the bar. It was dirty and sticky. Bartender was a bit annoyed in the beginning but once he read a receipt of an individual who didn't leave a tip and left a crappy note, he became overly friendly. Seriously the receipt was on the bar for everyone to see. It was on there for a good 15 minutes when I was there. Anyhoot it wasn't very busy but the place just gave me a bad vibe. I ordered a tall IPA and their boneless wings (Whiskey River® BBQ)...for $9 you get a nice sized amount (good enough for 2 people) but they don't really cover the wings so there were some that were just naked...seriously? It also comes on a few nacho chips...they were too salty. I didn't get anything else (although known for their burgers) since it wasn't a pleasant experience. 1 and done...

2 Stars is for the food 5 stars for the service Food ordered tower onion rings, Whisky river bbq burger(GOURMET) PRIME RIB DIP Well where do I even begin, First off GOURMET Burgers? NOT this is NOT what a Gourmet burger should be like. A FROZEN sliver of a burger piled high with shredded iceburg lettuce. The menu boasted this big beautiful burger with a nice juicy appetizing punch line that got my hubbys mouth to a Mouth-Orgasm just waiting for his order. Nope not even close his sister who can't cook for the life of her would've made a better burger. The burger was nowhere near gourmet quality and seriously lacking any kind of taste, when you have to douse it with a 1/2 a bottle of ketchup to bring it alive there is something wrong!  My PRIME RIB DIP, Red Robin are you kidding me, this was dried up LONDON BROIL, where do you get of trying to pass off this sandwich as prime rib, did you know I am the QUEEN of STEAK, I know my steak! Horrible tough chewy GREY london broil meat with au jus being Onion Soup Mix BROTH! Yuck just YUCK The only thing going for them is their steak fries and onion rings Then again NOT because the after effects of a swelled belly full of gas was not pleasant poor hubby suffered as well as me but it was a good competition for sure! Yes I am a woman and I FART! I own a good one too!  We shall consider this place as DEAD ROBIN! Service was Great even though

Filthy restaurant.   Dirty menus.     Staff that was more interested in bartending to their boyfriends than taking care of guests.  Greasssssy burger with cold French fries.  Impossible to get as drink refill unless u held up your glass and waived it in the face of your server.     Not my type of chain joint at all.  Will not be back

This Route 3 outpost is no better or worse than any other Red Robin. I went with a friend on a lazy Tuesday afternoon for a late lunch. While not overly packed, service was slow but amicable. When it comes to the food, stick with the basics (boneless wings came slathered in a tangy hot sauce with blue cheese crumbles atop crispy house made chips) and stick with the burgers (should've heeded my own advice: a Whiskey River grilled chicken wrap had a nice tang from the sauce but arrived overwhelmed with shredded lettuce).  The order/pay at the table app is a nice feature for those paying card instead of cash.

First time going! It was okay. Nothing fancy. Burgers were juicy but nothing fancy. We ordered the boneless buffalo chicken. Decent went the blue cheese crumbles on top, but are a bite too crunchy. I ordered the black pepper bacon burger with cheddar. But my bacon came out as regular bacon. No black pepper anywhere. A little misleading. But was juicy. The garlic parmesan fries were really good. Fresh sautéed garlic, with parmesan shreds.

Both today's visit and the one prior I received great servce and my burger was a homerun.  My smoke burger and fries were cooked perfectly, I loved it.    On my prior review the  service was almost non existent but I am happy to say the management has corrected the problem.  Good service makes such difference!

I have been going to Red Robins since I first found one in Atlanta a few blocks from my hotel. The staff is always friendly and service is usually spot on. It was a hot day and just wanted a Burger and a beer. I was satisfied by both. It is not best burger but if you want value in a comfortable atmosphere, this is the place I have tried all the burger joint Zin, smash, Steve's etc. They all have the good points, but Red Robin is local, friendly, inexpensive, and I will be back.

This is the second time at the Red Robin Clifton and in both cases service was TERRIBLE.  Does not deserve a rating. 10-9-2017. On my last visit, bathroom no TP in either stall, could you imagine. Told staff they looked at me like I had three heads. Was seated at the table and forgotten. Had to go look for the server. Server took order and got lost, went and looked for her again, she then came with three baskets of fries and drinks. Each basket had maybe 6 to 7 fries, not endless. I had to ask again now for forks and napkins. (On a side note the table next to us no server went to there table so they got up and left, the manager tried to stop them, they told him good bye.) Serve never came back until the order came out and of course my burger was wrong. I ordered a double taco tavern burger. So I went looking for the manager. He began arguing with me and telling me I order the large Taco Tavern burger and I was confused.  Mean while the burger I received was a regular cheese burger with lettuce and tomato.  You  would think he would have just apologized and got me what I original order but he had to tell me I was wrong. Later he brought the burger after that No One ever came back to the table to check on us.  We had to go look for the server and ask for the check.  After looking at the check, they took my burger off but so what. You think they would have told me that and apologized and tried to make me a happy customer? Obviously they do not care at all.  Since this is the second time I has bad service at the Clifton Red Robin I will never return. I like Red Robin, I have been to the Paramus, NJ store many times and always a great experience. SO I suggest if your local area go there.
I always have a good dining experience when I come here. The staff is friendly. The restaurant is kid friendly which makes it enjoyable for my children. The kids enjoy the burgers and shakes.

Was here yesterday afternoon for a 4th of July lunch with my fiance and stepdaughter.  Have been here several times and this time did not disappoint as it had not in the past either. It was pretty empty considering the holiday and good weather, so we got very quick service. Food was top-notch as it always is too. Have been here during peak hours and the service and quality does not diminish given the amount of guests they have.  With the new branding the chain has, this particular location has undergone some renovations with new seating and the addition of the electronic mini-kiosks with games, app and drink ordering, and credit card checkout. Always a fan of some "Yum" Red Robin eats!

Just took my family here today. Service was fair/ Staff took some time to attend us. The burgers were tasty and well prepared but overly high priced for such small portions. There were barely any fries on the plate. I think I would have made out better at Burger King. It cost me 70 dollars for 4 burgers, 4 drinks, and fries. There were barely any fries on the plate. Considering the price and small portions, I would not recommend going here.

A true fail of a Sunday dinner thanks to Red Robin in Clifton.  The wait for seating and food were both very long, and it was unnecessary.  Our server, while very friendly, had us waiting extra long for food.  I understand this happening when a restaurant is clearly swamped, but they weren't.  The table next to us got their food at the same time as us, except we ordered 30 minutes before them.   We had to ask the server 3x for status on the food.  Each time, we were told soon.  I told him to rush the kids' order for my baby daughter so she wouldn't be fussy, but he didn't bother to take these instructions to the kitchen.  When we received the food, they were all cold.  Not even room temperature - flat out cold from sitting out so long.   Never again, Red Robin Clifton.

It's a chain, but really!?!? How bad is this place!!! When I first started coming to this red robin it was good, but lately the food has gotten horrible over time. I think they switch cooks too often or something.  I ordered the Banzai burger, medium well. I was eating the burger, it was cooked perfectly, but at the last bites I noticed it was raw and cold! Also, I ordered it with and egg on top, and the egg white was still runny. My wife ordered a classic burger, just cheddar, lettuce and mayo. The thing was raw! Like literally fresh out the freezer and straight to the grill. This is about the third time this has happened to us.  Zin Burger is up the road, they make better burgers than this place! Even the Tic Tock Diner makes better than Red Robin. The quality has gone down the drain!!!

Perfect from beginning to end. Friendly wait staff. Burgers were cooked to perfection. The  wings for the appetizer was a little hard. The sand in your shorts drink was fine. Food was brought out before the soup and appetizer and the manager was nice enough to take it off the bill. Would recommend

This place is right around the corner from where I live. I've never had a bad meal here. They always have some sort of burger of the month going on and it's usually something really good. They added the bottomless fries to the menu and when I feel like having a cheat day, this is where I go.  The other good part about this place is that the service is pretty quick unlike some other chain restaurants I've been too. I don't think I've ever waited more than 15 minutes for a table or more than 20 for my food.  The staff is pretty knowledgable and friendly too. I would recommend to those who stay at the hotel connected to drop in.

I love gourmet burgers.  Before there was Zinburger nearby Red Robin was a good place to grab some good tasting patty bites.  My first visit was fantastic.  I loved their fries, onion rings, and of course burgers done right.  I was impressed and made more visits after that.  Then years passed and I haven't stepped foot into the place since.  Then an opportunity came one night.  While Zinburger would have been a good choice my buddy said we should go to Red Robin.  I didn't hear any objections so we decided to go for it.  Alas I wish we hadn't. This place has lost it's charm since my last visit.  I don't know if it was that particular night but the experience was just not good.  Walking to the restaurant it was a good size crowd but it was nowhere near busy.  That is why I don't understand why the table we were given was dirty.  I mean they took away the dishes and attempted to wipe it but the table was still dirty.  It looked like dirt had been baked into the very fiber of the table.  The seats were rickety and the couch was ripped and looked like it hadn't been taken care of for years.  Now I understand the chain restaurants can never be compared with traditional ones but still the management should try to keep the appeal of the place and at least make an effort to keep it looking new. The food was another disappointment.  We ordered the bar wings and pork riblets.  Both were cold and the chips underneath were soggy.  Probably because they had been sitting out in the open for so long.  Not a good start!  Then my Whiskey River burger came out and once again I was disappointed.  I asked for medium and they gave me medium well and the "crispy" onion  inside was the opposite of crispy.  I didn't even finish the burger which is something I never do.  Oh well there's always a first. It's too bad this place is not as good as it used to be.  Guess time changes all.  For this Robin time was not on it's side.

Mmm, who doesn't love good burgers and bottomless fries?! I love my burgers Classic - and Red Robin does classic right. I've been here a few times and signed up for the rewards program, which automatically gives any place for me a plus. During your birthday month, you get a burger for FREE! This couponer loves free, so I definitely took advantage. I came with my party of eight and every single one of us enjoyed our food. My friend, who had her first visit there that night, even texted me to go back the next week! Their campfire sauce is delicious, and their mac and cheese is creamy and tasty. I gave four stars out of five because the bathroom could use a little work. The place recently completed some renovations, however, and it looks great! Yay Red Robin!

Great food! Excellent service! Definetly a must have. Free parking available. It wasn't too busy plus it was Saturday lunch time. We were seated quickly our waiter came and took our drinks. Them when drinks came we had our order ready and the food came out rather quickly. The waiter came to check on us a couple of times so I liked when they come ask if we need anything else because dinning out with kids it rough.

I used to come here regularly and I really love the food, but every time I visit I consistently get food poisoning from this location. Came in last night with my girl for a bite and we're both suffering from extreme nausea and basically can't hold anything down. Hopefully the GM picks it up and starts upholding food safety regulations

I havent been to a red robin in 4 years and let me tell you its still good. The burgers are awesome  even the salads are big fresh and yummy options.. I am so glad they still had the mountain high pie
I wouldn't necessarily call these gourmet burgers,  they taste like patties that are pre frozen. Nothing special, but it's edible.

Found hair in the food, manager came over and offered more food to make up for the situation.  I asked her if she would take more food from a kitchen that severed dirty food.  She said she working  in the food industry she would.  Wait staff was friendly enough not that it matter what you have an apparent concurrence to sub par health standards.  I am going to end this review now so i can go vomit.

Came here today for an early dinner. Ordered the mozzerella sticks for an app.  Wasn't that great.  Breading was far too thick with no flavor. Ordered the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger and Oreo milkshake.  The burger was cooked exactly how I ordered it, tasted wonderful.  Perfect.  The fries had no Red Robin classic seasoning on them, completly plain, nothing that I remember from years ago.  The milkshake was great. My boyfriend got a regular cheeseburger and garlic parm fries.  He wasn't impressed with the burger and the fries were completly soggy/undercooked.   Hope they improve on their quality, we've enjoyed coming here in the past.  Would love to see them do better.

Delicious.. I ate here just yesterday, but I don't recall the name of my burger. I did however, have a monster milkshake, banana flavored, and it was delicious. The burger came with fries, and they were lightly salted so I added a bit more.. I'd definitely go come back to eat here.

Got in at dinner time New Year's Day. Not a long wait we had to order a gluten free menu and the waitress knew many of the options so there was no need for it. Red Robin offers gluten free buns which turned out to be outstanding. The food was great ( I can always find a new unique combination here). The preparation time was quick, everything was hot and tasty. the waitress made sure with repeated visits that our meal was fine. Can't say enough this place is great and we'll be back soon.

I'm not sure where all the negative reviews came from, but I thought everything was delicious. Great fries, great salad, great burger. The mac n cheese on the burger could've been a liiiiitttle cheesier, but it was still tasty. Very fast and friendly service.

Horrible service. Staff spoke about customers while at front at host desk. They made me disgusted and I will not ever be back. Plus they took 30 minutes after my scheduled pick up time! Way to long. Horrible service.

I've been to this Red Robin countless number of times and unfortunately, I feel as though the food quality has been getting worse and worse over the past year.  This Red Robin used to be the gold standard of Red Robins, and other chain restaurants as well but now, it takes some arm-twisting for me to drive far to come to this RR location.  The space of this RR is pretty nice though. Good layout and atmosphere.  The food is usually on point although the burgers quality has slipped recently, but they handle special requests pretty well.  The service here is definitely lacking. Past few times I've been here, I feel like I've had to struggle to get the servers' attention and it seems to take way to long to receive simple requests like refill on water or honey-mustard condiment.  If they can improve their food quality to what it once was, it would go a long way.

This was my first time using curbside pickup from any restaurant.  I had not been to Red Robin in a long time but was craving a Royal Red Robin on Saturday July 1.  Their website advertised 12 minute pickup, so I ordered and headed over.  I live less than ten minutes away.  My online order was placed at 8:04 PM with a pickup time of 8:16 PM.  I arrived a couple of minutes early and parked in the curbside pickup spot - there's 3 of them, and there was one other car waiting.  The parking lot was maybe half full.  The other car had their order delivered within a couple of minutes, so I waited patiently.  Another car soon pulled in to the curbside pickup spot and waited with me.  After about 5 minutes he went inside and a minute or so later came back out and sat in his car.  Now it's getting to about 8:25 and we're both waiting.  I pass some more time in the car and finally can't take the waiting anymore and go inside at about 8:35. There's a hostess at the hostess stand and a separate pickup stand.  I wait by the pickup stand for close to 5 minutes.  The hostess doesn't acknowledge me nor gets anyone to help me.  There are several receipts laying on the counter, and I find mine with a time stamp of 8:05.  Finally someone comes to the stand and I point out my receipt, and they respond that they'll check on my order and disappear into the kitchen.  Shortly after someone not in uniform came by and asked if i was helped (manager?).  I said yes and they moved on and never talked to me again.  The other pickup customer comes back in and I ask him if he'd ever ordered curbside before and he said no, but he was as frustrated as I was.  In a couple of minutes the server came back and said my order would be right out.  The other pickup customer waited with me. Finally at 8:45 my order came out.  I asked if there was a problem with my order and the response was no but they were 'busy'.  The restaurant wasn't much more than half full - with plenty of empty tables - so i asked "if I placed an order with a waitress at 8:05 would my order have come out by now?" and the answer was "yeah - probably".  I then said that the website stated 12 minute service (didn't really expect that) and he said there was a third party website that processed the orders.  Yet the the ticket on the counter was printed at 8:05!  He finished with "look I just work here" to which I responded "well then pass it on". That being said when I got home 10 minutes later the burger was hot but the fries were cold. Curbside pickup doesn't work anywhere close to what is advertised and I would NEVER use it again.

I had my "Birthday Free Burger" here and it was delish! I went with something totally out of the ordinary for me - the Red Robin Royal topped with a sunny side fried egg. It went beyond my expectations of what it would taste like. The egg was cooked just right and when you cut the sandwich in half the soft yolk of the egg dripped down the sides of the burger just right. The uncommon combo of the quality burger and breakfast staple was like having breakfast and dinner at the same time -soo good. Will definitely have another.   The server was very good as well. She was bringing refills quicker than you put down an empty glass. A dinner companion of course ordered the onion ring tower, the large one. They were good, but way too much for our party of 3. They were good reheated at home too the next day.

This place has awful service!!!! Every time I have come here I'd wait a good hour for my food and it would be cold and my fries wouldn't be fresh. It's impossible to even get your waitresses attention. They didn't give me napkins for my messy burger, I asked several times and didn't get them until the waitress decided to give me my check. So I decided I wouldn't dine in anymore but I love their burgers so I called to order my food and I was put on hold for 12 minutes so I figured they were extremely busy. When I got there, there wasn't one customer in the place and the staff was chit chatting and neither one of them decided to come to the front and ask what I needed. What a shame because their burgers are delicious.

The atmosphere is always family friendly, but I remember the burgers being a bit bigger than they are now. I appreciate the endless fries but I rather get full from a delicious plump burger than several servings of fries.

The place was absolutely filthy. There was mold growing on the side of the booths platform near the floor.  There were tables that a "busboy" never cleared let alone cleaned throughout the entire restaurant during our time there. The Manager was telling them to clean up but noone wanted to. We could smell alcohol very strongly coming from our waiters breath. Bathroom had more toilet paper on the floor than on the roll, no paper towels. After our check was paid for by credit card using their kiosk on our table it was telling us there was another balance for $2.99 (not sure why) but waiter said we owed for a drink. So I gave $3 cash and as the waiter walked away, he put it in his pocket. I've never been to a red robin so we thought we'd give it a try. But it was the worst experience ever! And I'm not picky. I will never go to another Red Robin ever!

I love this place. The only bad thing about it is that I recently went vegetarian and they have nothing for any vegetarians.  I mean I had the fist instead of meat and honestly it was pretty bad. I went to red robins because I like my friends to feel comfortable eating out with me but if it was my choice I wouldn't go here

Typical Chain Restaurant  Atmosphere: Laid back-Plenty of flat screens playing sports. Seated right away. Food: Peach lemonade( too sweet I poured water to make it to my liking)   Wings on top of Yula chips (I did not take the sauce)  Parking lot with plenty of parking
This place is disgusting, the tables are always sticky and dirty.  If you ask the staff to wipe it down they use a wet towel that looks like it never been washed.

We had dinner here on a Wednesday afternoon. It wasn't crowded, we were seated right away. Food was good comparing to a red robin that we've been to, but of course, the same food costs more here. Waiter was very enthusiastic. We were able to use our coupon for half price a burger. Nice!  Down side: they're a little stingy on the appetizer. Also, I wish they didnt drizzle so much sauce, made my red robin burger soggy. The unlimited fries taste good but was small, which is ok because we didnt need refill.

The good: Bottomless fries. Steak fries, my favorite kind. Bottomless dipping sauces. The... looked like honey mustard, but it had poppy seeds... and the Thai chili are my favorite. My choice of bun (the cornmeal jalapeno was really nice). Bottomless drinks that no one else can match, including root beer floats! Not so good: The floats were made with soft serve - vanilla only - not real ice cream. I still downed four of them, but I know I'll be unhappy about it later. We had a group of seven, and we needed multiple refills at a time, so they ended up being a bit slow to get there. I can understand why. It's a negative of my experience, but I can't really deduct for it because I can only imagine how much more crowded we made the bar. Decent: The burger. They do pink or not-pink, so my request for "as rare as they'll allow it" still came out pink. So it goes. Nothing terrific about the flavor - like your standard Five Guys type pattie. Unfortunately, nothing terrific about the other toppings, either. The onion straws were flavorless. I asked for ghost sauce on my burger, and for the extra 75 cents, I barely tasted anything resembling spicy. In fact, there wasn't even much BBQ sauce on it either, and that was standard. Verdict: On the better half of the burger chains, but not worth the elevated prices for what they claim to be "gourmet." You want gourmet, go to Smashburger, Elevation Burger, Zinburger, or many other places in North Jersey. If you want to shove massive amounts of food into your craw, for the same price you can get a triple or quad patty at Five Guys, all the free toppings, and a massive side of fries, along with unlimited trips to the soda machine. Every place I named in this paragraph is a place I'd rather go. Sorry, Robin!

Came here for lunch with friends.  The service was great,  fast and courteous. Our server checked on us often. The food was excellent,  they have a great menu. I had the black and bleu burger and it was excellent. I would recommend Red Robin to other people.

Love this franchise! Been to a few of them in different places and they have always been consistently good. They do make really good burgers.  My favorite one is the one where they put a sunny side up egg on top. They cook the egg just right, so when you bite into it, the yolk will break all over the top of the burger. They have good desserts too. Good food and it's all affordable.  Great family place. We will continue to eat here.

I am being generous on this one. Our server Amy was the only high point to this meal. I went to this location a couple of years back, but though maybe I hit it on a bad day so I went back.OMG what a bad choice it was.. We had a tower of onion rings which were not bad, but $9.00 for 13 rings. Two out of the 3 of us had burgers and my daughter has a chicken dish. She said the chicken was ok, but it was nothing special. She also ordered the speckled lemonade which was a bottomless drink ,but with the way it was carelessly prepared getting past one is hard enough. For a place that is supposed to be a specialty burger shop it leaves much to be desired. the burgers themselves look to be frozen blanks. They are flavorless where you would be better off buying frozen patties at a wholesale club. There are many different ways you can top it off but it is like putting lipstick on a pig...it is still a pig. Here's is an example...My wife had a Royal Red Robin burger and I had what is called a Pub Burger. The version I had was called Fiery Ghost. The way they are listed on the menu is that they are 2 completely different style of burgers and the process is much different . In reality they look to be the exact same burger with just different toppings.. The care in which the for was prepared was disappointing. There was no care put into the process or preparation .If our food had slightly resembled the picture it would not be so bad, but these burgers were not even close .I know you are saying I could have sent the food back ,but I against doing so, because you never know what is going to come back to you. 2 soda's ,1 Speckled Lemonade,1 onion ring tower,2 burgers & an order of Ensenada Chicken..$69.00 (tip included) .That comes to $23 per person without any alcohol for a burger place.The tip was the best part of the money spent. There are much better places to go close by You can get a 5 guys burger done the way you want it fresh juicy & full of flavor for 1/2 the cost.

I am a huge fan of Red Robin. This location does the chain good. I have yet to find a Red Robin that I was not happy with the service or food. This location is great and I was very happy eating here. The food was served in a timely manner and was at the right temperature. The server staff was attentive and friendly. The location was also kept clean with fair lighting. I enjoy the atmosphere of these restaurants. They have a parking lot that you will be hard pressed to not find a good spot to park.

I really enjoy Red Robin's.  Been going for years, and while a few flops on occasion, usually excellent service, they do a good job hiring some excellent waiters and waitresses.  Meanwhile, bottomless fries, great mozzarella sticks (and do they still have those Zucchini Sticks?), Ensenada Chicken platter, Blue Moon shake, Stella on tap, had that pretzels thing going with the beer mustard or something like that, and I seem to recall some sort of Octoberfest burger.  Some of their seasonal menu items make you wish they were regulars.  I have to say, this place is comfort food for me.  Even just a beer and some fries here will do it.  By the way, tip: try their ranch dressing with their fries. ;) Another tip: for a burger joint, it's my experience that their burgers are not necessarily their strength, so try some entrees.

This is long overdue. I have been coming here for years and have never encountered any terrible or mediocre experiences but in the past few months now there is an official Trend that the service is just flat out not good or slowly going down the drain.After giving this place another try post encountering either bad service or having the food take forever to come out, today takes the cake. We waited for 20 mins for a table and then another 15 to have a server come greet us. People that were seated after us were already served drinks and apps before us.  The waitress was not knowledgeable on anything related to drinks or she was playing stupid that she didn't know and she didn't come check on our table as she would her other tables around us AND when we asked for more fries it literally took like 15 mins and only brought out one small order for a party of 6. If that doesn't make you want to get up and leave, I don't know what will. If you are looking for slow service, a bad experience, annoyance, starvation, please head over to Red Robin's in Clifton. I'm so disappointed, the food was great but the service, smh.

Boo Boo wanted to try a red robin ever since they were opening in the palisades mall up in NY. I told her there is one nearby in NNJ. When we went the parking lot was full. A bus had taken up like 5-10 spaces. Alost every table was full but we were still able to get seated on a booth.  Boo Boo and I shared the onion ring tower. She liked that it came with ranch dressing and a chipotle mayo for dipping. I got the pub burger and she orders the bacon and cheese burger. She was just let down overall. I was ok it with knowing that RR is just like a typical franchise place like an applebees, Friday's. I won't go into detail why Boo Boo didn't like her burger. But she told me not to bother signing up for burger rewards program. My burger was over cooked and was dry. It was not worth returning it as the service was really busy. Our waiter was very attentive and did a good job.  The meal with 1 beer, 2 average burgers, and 1 appetizer (onion rings) the total came to over $50 with tax and tip. I will stick to smash burger from here on out.

Went on a Saturday night and had a black and blue burger, wife had Avo-Cobb-O salad. Let's start with the burger, I've been coming back to this place for the past 3 years every couple of weeks for one of these and they were always great, however something has clearly changed. The burger was unrecognizable from all my previous encounters with it, a big letdown. The salad on the other hand was also not anywhere close to what the menu said. When we asked our waitress about the differences in the salad we were informed that they were out of some ingredients (including eggs...seriously? you ran out of eggs? ). Quick Tip: If you don't have the ingredients needed for the meal...don't make the meal. Additionally later that night after getting back home I got sick and ended up throwing up my burger...yum

I have had a chance to eat at two different stores. One on the west coast and one on the east coast. Terrible, the burger itself is good and the servers very pleasant and attentive, however the general quality of the good is horrible. The cup of French onion soup , which used to be very good, is now tasteless canned beef stock with crunchy onion slices in a small ugly dip tray. The boneless wings are served on a bed on potato chips, which were more tender than the inedible wings. I thought this was just an anomaly at one store but now I know it is system wide. To bad used to be a good place to go

I have not had a burger from here in years, in fact I don't know how long it's been. We ordered food to go over the phone and let me just say the girl on the phone was just adorable and our order was perfect. We all had just a cheeseburger/fries. Pretzel bites and Mac & Cheese. Everything was just delicious. Would definitely eat here again.

We enjoyed the atmosphere very much. I'm a vegetarian, and they could do any one of their burgers as a veggie burger. I had the black and blue burger. It was on the salty side, maYbe from the blue cheese and blue cheese sauce, but was good. I really recommend the towering onion. It's outta this world! Great place for kids, by the way. The kid's menu was quite good. I especially liked the friendly service.

It's been years since I'd been back to RR and I must say I really enjoyed my mean. Started off with Onion rings then my bacon cheese burger with garlic and parm fries....had no space for the Just Doh it! Our waitress Carli was very pleasant and dealt with our humor very well!

First time I've been to a Red Robin in years!  I was out there with one of my good friends to get a bite to eat and I was excited coming back to this place.  It wasn't that Red Robin was hard to find, but its sign is overshadowed by the large La Quinta Inn sign, so if you see that La Quinta on Rt 3 East in Clifton, then that's where you need to be for Red Robin. The restaurant was sort of packed at first but it really winded down after USA won their World Cup match. We didn't get appetizers, but I did order a couple of Yuenglings after we learned that they were out of Stella Artois. No big deal personally because I am not a huge beer drinker. I asked which burger was good and the server (who had a striking resemblance to the Tampa Bay Rays' Pitcher David Price) ended up suggesting the Black & Blue Burger, which was one of 3 new burgers at Red Robin. It tasted great! It was a burger with sauteed onions, mushrooms, and blue cheese crumbles on ciabatta bread. The fries were very good too; there was this dipping sauce, which I believe was for the burger as a tangy, cheesy mayonnaise but I used it for the fries. All in all, the service was good and quick, it wasn't too loud and we were able to catch up and watch the rest of the USA game! I will be definitely going back as there are two burgers that I haven't had in forever that I need in my life...the Royal Red and the Big Kahuna. I don't even know if those are the names but one has a fried egg, and the other has grilled pineapple.

Hair in my food. Flat greasy fried food  and dead salad. Stay away if you can, three people got sick afterwards. Staffed by new computer ordering that was just plain stupid !!! Dirty where you can see and worse where you can't.

For some reason I'm still a member of their royalty program and received a free entree coupon for my bday (which IS nice).  I forgot why I don't go. Service is non existent. Want a knife? Wait for dishwasher to stop running. "Bottomless" fries from your initial 10 that you got? Wait 15 minutes and then become disinterested. Want another beer? Go home to your fridge. Food isn't half bad, but more than 7 steak fries and maybe some warm sweet potato fries would be nice. I should've photoed it.
I always enjoy Red Robin. Burgers are good and who does not love endless fries. Little attitude when asking for additional fries, other then that was a good meal.

I came here excited for "gourmet" burgers but was quickly disappointed to see that there were 0 dishes with Robin on the menu. Actually, the only bird flavored foods available were turkey or chicken (not very gourmet). KFC have chicken but let it be known that Red Robin do not sell Robin. I'm not sure if there are any class action lawsuits regarding this matter (but please let me know). Instead of eating I just drank 6 booze themed milkshakes until it felt like my guts would explode. If you drink the Spiked Grasshopper Shake in one sip like a shot it makes your forehead feel funny and makes the badge wearing servers, lack of robin dishes, and Eddie Money soundtrack tolerable.

It was a toss up between 2 and 3 stars, but I decided to give Red Robin the benefit of the doubt.  Most of my visits here have been fine, which is why I ultimately decided to go with three stars.  My visit here last week was anything but fine though. Previous Visits: Have dined in a few times with decent service and the food was prepared well and tasted good.  Previously ordered pick-up once before (Cobb Salad) and it was good as well. Last Week's Visit: I placed an order for take-out over the phone.  I arrived to pick up my order and they said it would be a few minutes, fine.  I waited and then was handed my food.  I peered into the bag and saw utensils, two containers of salad dressing, and a large box that had a considerable weight to it (presumably my burger and salad).  I drove home and settled in at my kitchen table to enjoy my dinner, but I was in for a rude surprise when I opened the box.  Inside the box was just my Bleu Ribbon Burger with an empty compartment next to it where my salad should have been.  I called the restaurant up to notify them of my missing salad.  The employee said, "I realized right after you left that I forgot to give you your salad."  So, I left my burger, and drove back to Red Robin to pick up my salad.  The employee actually gave me two house salads because he felt bad.  Well, by the time I got home, my burger was no longer hot, but just warm.  It still tasted good though.  Great flavor!  The salad was alright, probably not worth the gas money of driving back to pick it up though. Morale of the story: Check to make sure everything is in your bag before you leave the restaurant to avoid an extra trip.  The employee was very apologetic and sincere which is why I decided to ultimately give 3 stars instead of 2. Also, be very careful driving your car in their parking lot.  There are some massive pot holes turned craters that will mess up your car!

Cool place for a quick stop but nothing to write home about. Parking lot parking is available so it's not a fight for a parking spot. They are open in all weather conditions. No snow stops their opening. The seasoned fries are ok. The bar drinks are flavorful but can stand to be stronger. Cool names for the drinks though. Reasonable prices for great bugers.

I had a pretty good time here on a Saturday evening for a meal. I had no idea its only recently opened, from look of inside I would've thought its been opened a while. Overall the restaurant is what you expect of Red Robin and other american family style restaurants. A lot of memorabilia on the walls and soft lights.  The server we had was really friendly and I had no complaints. The food were pretty decent, I've always been a fan of Red Robins because of their burger selection. This time I had the guacamole bacon burger done on medium and I have no complaints. We also had the Arctic Cod and fries plate and the fish were really fresh I thought and really right off the fryers as it was burning hot. The only downside would be the location.. Instead of located within the AMC complex its bit further off sharing parking lot with a La Qunita inn that you have to get back on NJ 3 east. Overall its was a good visit for me and if there's a chance in the future would definitely come back again.

Wow - I'm surprised to see so many harsh and negative reviews.  Maybe everyone misses the old places like 'Yellow Jackets' and 'Bumpers' (complete with half of a classic car bursting through the side of the building) that stood here before a chain restaurant took over?   I've only ever bothered going for lunch (usually after seeing a flick at the AMC down the road a bit) and it's always been really good.   They can knock out a damn tasty and unique burger (all the lunatics on here that rave about the endless fries - where do you find the room to eat more than one serving?!) and to wash it down how can't you love  those "can-crafted cocktails"?  Two of those drinks and I'm no longer angry that a small popcorn at the AMC I was just at costs more than the ticket for the movie itself.

Burgers are just average. Fries are way too thick. Onion rings are frozen. The chicken Cesar wrap was fatty and tasted old. Milkshakes are decent. Service is slow. Overall food there isn't fresh and there are better hamburger options.

I have only sat in the bar area but the food is delicious, lots of variety and very fresh. Their menu has new additions all the time. The burgers are just amazing. The fries are good too and lots of flavorful dipping sauce choices. The drinks are pretty interesting too. As with any place, how good the drinks are varies with the bartender (i.e. if it's too strong too sweet etc) but they are always fine about changing your drink if you don't like it. Their desserts look amazing but I have yet to survive through appetizers and burgers to make it to dessert with any room left in my tummy!  I only hold back the 5th star because the service varies with bartenders. Some are great some are barely paying attention even if the restaurant is empty so it's really hit or miss.

The service was fine. However do not order the grilled chicken salad it is robbery and grizzly, the lettuce looks like it's come right out of a bag. Also I don't know how they did it but my burger was half cooked perfectly and the other half was grossly. Gourmet is an overstatement

Ordered the $6.99 Burger with bottomless fries at the Foothill Ranch location in California.  The burger looks nothing like the commercial or on the menu.  Looked like something from McDonalds.  Extremely disappointed and won't be baited again.

I continue to forget to bypass the turkey burgers here. They are overly flavored (like a sausage) and have a strange rubbery breakfast sausage link texture. The patties are NOT freshly ground and formed.  Walking in, the place was pretty empty. I was seated right away. I ordered the turkey burger with fries and the gingerbread milkshake. On first sip I thought the milkshake was very tasty. Gingerbread flavor was strong and warming.My milkshake glass had hard black bits on the inside which I assumed were the remnants of someone's cookies and cream milk shake. When addressed with the server, he apologized and replaced it with a cleaner glass of not so flavorful milkshake. Bummer. No more complaining. I described my burger experience above, ordered an additional helping of endless fries and left feeling fed but unfulfilled.

Ate a chili chili cheeseburger on 9/1 for dinner and woke up in the night with fevers, chills, abdominal pain, and diarrhea.  My husband had the A1 peppercorn and was fine but I've been out of work for two days because of the food poisoning!  Will not return.

When you come in:  1/5 The waiting area is small and can get packed when busy, which is often. When they take your name they don't have a beeper system to notify you or take your phone number so you're forced to stay in the lacking waiting area. We came on a Tuesday night with 5 people and the wait was 30 min.  There seemed to be a lot of empty tables but I guess they didn't have enough waiters to seat the people waiting. The seater/host Kevin was very nice and apologetic about the wait.  Waitress/Waiter service: 5/5 Our waitress Nicole took care of business. She is the Bruce Springsteen of red robin. Super nice and quick. Food came out quick. She checked our drinks often. Got check to us quick. The food: 5/5 The food is like God descended and made your taste buds Jesus. My friend said the banzai burger has a unique taste that no other restaurant can recreate and is worth coming back for. I got the whiskey BBQ burger which was tasty if you're into BBQ. The fries are great and are bottomless so the goodness never has to end. Campfire sauce is boss... it's amazing they should sell it in bottles like ketchup , I would buy it. The red robin seasoning blend add good flavor to the fries and is recommended. The drinks were ok. My friend said the dr. pepper tasted watered down. The freckled lemonade was perfect according to another friend. The onion ring tower was delicious.  Conclusion: Overall good experience because the food is like crack. The wait to be seated sucked especially when you see empty tables.

I enjoyed the meal. Quick service and the food was fabulous. I wasn't a fan of the chili cheeseburger but everything else was great. I will come back and try something else to update my review. Price was reasonable and the waiter was extremely polite and attentive.

I hope you go there with money! So i went over there this weekend with my girlfriend and my 2 younger cousins...  We ordered 4 burgers, 3 milk shakes, 3 sodas and a water. Total was $88! They have tablet on the tables with all these games... What do i know when i go to pay the bill, the games are not FREE! Fries are not all free. Come about 10 fries with burger, I asked for more and the the server said "you have fries, i just gave it to you". I So i said I wanted more cuz 10 were not enough. He responds "finish those first". WOW I'm not a child to get more food than I can't handle to not eat.. The only reason I gave this a 2 star was because the sandwich was really good, even though it was $11 I dont think its worth that much money. Will never go again.

I was at this location on Saturday with my family.  The burgers are always fantastic and I never know which one to order as the selections all sound so good!  My husband and I both had the prime choice burger and were able to use our buy one, get the second 50% off.  Our waiter was so nice and attentive, checking on us often.  Will be going back again soon!

Love it here one of my favorite restaurants is red robin my all time favorite is the royal burger this is the best burger on the menu burger bacon cheese and a fried egg what more could you ask for?!?!?! Bottomless fries are so clutch here and there fries are delicious!! The host are always kind and seat us as fast as possible hardly any wait time there is a full bar big parking lot an abundance of seating  Servers are so helpful polite and happy so great!! Bathrooms here are always clean and never smelly! Better than the one in secaucus their service sucks and it's always freezing in that place the drive over to Clifton is well worth it this is my favorite red robin around!!

I have never been to a red robin before! My first time was due to my dear husband who has a love for greasy, junk food....preferably from a nationwide chain. We could not be on more opposite sides of the dining out preference spectrum. Anyway, after trying to convince him to go eat some Turkish food I finally gave in to my rumbling tummy because I was hangry!  I wasn't sure what to expect but my expectations were low. The service was excellent. We ordered Thai chicken wings to start and they were seriously DELISH! I was hoping to find something healthy for my entree but it wasn't easy. I just said screw it and ordered the bourbon bbq grilled chicken sandwich. It was also good. I loved the crispy onions. Towards the end of the meal I decided to check for calories online and read that the sandwich I just consumed was.....wait for it......982 calories. I literally wanted to stab my husband, who then asked if I still wanted my last bite considering my findings. To which I said....uh yea I made it this far, might as well! So is Red Robins good.....I guess, if you want some junk to splurge ALOT of calories on. But please do not eat here frequently unless you want a combo of hypertension, diabetes and heart disease.  Oh...and they have bottomless fries, to add insult to injury!

Ok so I had a gift card from a friend I had got for this place. Today was just a good day to use it.      Parking is adequate for the lunch crowd. The greeter sat us immediately in a booth and our server Matt came over to ask us if we wanted drinks. He was very friendly and professional.     The food was all spot on and the flavor was perfect for what we ordered I got a bacon cheeseburger w/sautéed mushrooms and a side of ranch dressing. Just a hint if you order boneless wings ask for a side of blue cheese. It does not come with it. They also have a reward program that you can sign up for.

Wow!! My friend had her son, my godson's birthday there tonight! The service was not just bad it was HORRIBLE!! No napkins, waited over 20 minutes to place order, then over 20 minutes to get food!! Soup cold and I didn't get my plain cheeseburger till after everyone almost finished their food! The kicker was...., the restaurant was almost empty!!! What a disappointment!!
I don't get what people love so much about their burgers.  They are just ok to me.  I'd rather go to Five Guys, Jakes Wayback burgers or Smashburger.

We came here about 2 weeks ago on a whim, even though we've been talking about coming here after seeing the commercials lately... Anyways my bf got a bacon burger and he said it was really good and I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich with bacon avocado lettuce tomato fried crunchy onion straws and wow it was really good! We also split a tower of onions rings with two different sauces and the onion rings were really good! We also got freckled lemonade which is lemonade and crushed strawberries which is a must when you go there. Service was quick and efficient. We will definitely be back we loved everything!

Me and my family love Red Robbins burgers, unfortunately this locations service SUCKS. Every time I go there lately it gets worse and worse. The managers don't care either.. Late food, cold food, wrong order.. Barely an apology or a comp to say the least. It's a shame. I'll just take my business to zinburger/smashburger/the counter - luckily this area is filled with food choices.. Keep it up red Robbin and you will find yourself out of business real soon.
Terrible service, felt like I was invisible. Ignored and burger not done as ordered no silverware.

I've been to this location twice in the past 6 weeks, once for lunch & once late night on a Saturday night. The service was very good. The food came out promptly and the staff were friendly. The hamburger was better than I expected and I like how they have replacement selections instead of having to get french fries. There are strategically placed big screen tv's that blend into the decor without appearing like a sports bar. I'll go back again and if it's very busy, hopefully get the same level of service.
The burgers are delish and the SVC was good.It was clean and overall a friendly family atmosphere.

FINALLY!!!  I got to try this & it did live up to the hype.  My burger was filling, we had great service, and they had a clean place with nice restrooms.  Happy about the unlimited fries (though I don't eat much so it wasn't as beneficial to me) & I got to have a basic burger the way I wanted it.  They had music in the restrooms along with a TV on when you walked in but okay.... I hate that this very good Red Robin requires me to cross tolls & drive in NYC traffic from Queens (not to mention that crazy turn around on NJ 3 East).  Why can't the one in Long Island take a cue & be more like this one?  They had space, they weren't condescending jerks & the employees were friendly and accommodating.  Oh, and we were there at lunch time on a Friday afternoon & had NO WAIT AT ALL. One of the few locations of any chain restaurant attached to a hotel that I got good service from.  Hope the Red Robin franchise people or the corporation read these reviews & take them seriously.

Not a fan of this place at all. Eight of us had a meal here and six of us left very unsatisfied. For two people it was their first time eating at Red Robin and it was not a good impression. Our service was very slow. Yes, there were eight of us but the place was not busy at all. Our waitress was unfriendly and we had to ask for things two or more times. I sensed that she was annoyed having to serve us. Our appetizers were very good I must say. Our food was a different story. My boyfriend had the whiskey BBQ burger. It came out cold and had hardly any BBQ sauce on it. His fries were cold, too. I had the blackened chicken sandwich which was very spicy and salty. Others sent their food back because their burgers weren't cooked right or there food was cold. One had the ribs and they were dry. We did talk to the manager and he was nice and apologetic. He also took some things off our bill. But it wasn't a pleasant experience. Disappointed. The burgers don't eve look like they do on the menu. They look like they came from Burger King.

Steak fries, steak fries and more steak fries. That's the only reason I ever drive out of the city and into a Red Robin. Sure the burgers are good but I can get a comparable burger much closer to home and definitely from my own kitchen. I've been to a few of these stores and they're all relatively the same, you wait an hour to be seated, you get friendly service and good food for a decent price.  I can't say that I was overwhelmed by the food at this location but I was definitely overwhelmed by the crowds of surburanites, probably due to it being the only one for miles and miles. It was as if the Walmart closed and everyone migrated to Red Robin for a burger.  I will definitely recommend the milkshakes, but don't be fooled into getting the monster sized version. It was way too much for me and I'm a big guy.

Two words: ENDLESS FRIES. The food is standard chain restaurant food, but the fries are a nice touch. Parking is a little confusing but manageable. Close enough to the AMC plaza to catch a movie after.

It's been a while since I've eaten here & so disappointing. 2 Stars are for the "home made" chips - they were hot, crispy & not greasy at all but no dipping sauce.  My crispy chicken sandwich was crispy, very dry & mostly breading  Even bun was crispy - means it's been sitting awhile

Red Robin is known for its burgers and it delivers a decent burger, although it's hard to compete now with the many burger chains and unique burger offerings around Bergen County. Good for a quick, casual stop, where you want to eat a lot for a little price.

I used to love this place!! As you read some of the reviews you will see a few people say how good this place used to be.  It was!! I used to really look forward to coming to the RR for dinner but the last time I went not one thing went well.  We waited over a half hour to sit in an empty section, why the wait? Have no idea, none at all.  Our table was sticky and filthy.  My food was cold and my wife would not even eat hers, saying it was greasy and awful.  What a shame!! I thought maybe it was a one night issue but after reading the other reviews I can see this place has juts gone to the dumps.

Okay well let me start off by saying that when me and my friend walked into red Robins it was okay busy but not busy enough to start a waiting line which they had so that was pretty weird second when we got to our seats we found out of course there was garbage left behind the seed that we found we put on the table for the waiter to pick up which he never did until the second time he came back so we ordered the bottomless root beer floats they were very delicious and definitely worth it next I ordered the spicy ghost pepper burger medium rare it did not come out medium rare sadly though also they didn't even bring me the right burger the first time it took them two tries until they got me the right burger, so that was a disappointment the same went for my friend he didn't get his burger cooked the way he wanted to second it took the waiter two times to try and get me my bottomless fries which of course we're not seasoned at all the only time they seasoned my fries is when I got them to go which was pretty weird as well they should have been doing that the whole time, although service did increase during the time I was there and he was very apologetic about everything so that guess that kind of made up for it but in the near future I hope it doesn't happen again PS the food is still good as long as they season your food

Wife and I went for lunch, we were happy when we arrived it was pretty empty so we sat down immediately.  The arrival of an Iced tea.... without sweetener, took 15 minutes to actually have it delivered, but the beer had not arrived yet.  We ordered 2 burgers, which arrived almost 20 minutes later, the burgers were hot, the fries were cold, I asked for hot ones, which arrived after we had finished our burgers.   Did I mention the place was empty?  Both burgers were good, when the fries arrived they were good,  but why it takes so long.....

The quality in this place seems to swing up and down. Right now they are in a major downward swing. On my latest visit I ordered a whiskey river burger hold the lettuce and tomatoes.  When the burger arrived it appeared to have only half a slice of cheese sliding off the side and almost no bbq sauce.  I then noticed bits of green lettuce and realized they had put on the lettuce and tomato then scraped it off. I can assume that's were my cheese and bbq sauce went too. The French fries are the "wide plank" style and are never cooked enough and this time had a strong onion flavor. They come in little metal rings and are called bottomless. You can order more at no charge but you need to track down your server and then wait for them to be cooked.  My  wife had the crab cake sandwich which says jumbo lump crab meat but in reality is a mushy mess more like tuna from a can. No lumps of crab in there just lots of filler.  For the prices they get there are much better places.  I think I'll avoid them for a while until they get on the upswing.

I was very disappointed my burger was over cooked and the waitress smelled like cigarettes this was the third time I've been disappointed and I am unlikely to go back  My issues have largely been service related from being ignored by waitstaff to witnessing gross PDA.

They still have some goods burgers but I noticed that the buns were different, almost the cheap, old and stale kind. Hopefully it's not going to be like that next time. I also noticed that this restaurant isn't as busy as it used to be, maybe it's the food or the service, who knows.

We've loved RR for years now and as luck would have it, there is one very close to our house.  We've been coming here quite a bit since we bought the house 3 years ago.  Sadly, as the time passes, the quality of the food has been declining.  The chicken sandwiches were always fantastic, but as of late, the chicken breasts are smaller and dryer.  The burgers are just frozen patties.  The steak fries, which were always my favorite, are really nothing to write home about.  I'm not sure what brought about this change, but I think we've given it just about all the chances we are willing to give.  They need to fix the quality of the food ASAP and I won't even go into the awful service we've had the last 3 times with (as luck would have it) the same terrible waitress.  Very disappointed.  :( PS  Note that the great reviews for this place are all old.  Had I originally reviewed it 3 years ago, it probably would have been 4-5 stars.
The food is delicious.  I'm in love with the Raspberry Cream Soda, the gourmet's Burgers and the fries. I will definitely visit again. The waitress was extremely nice.
Excellent burgers and fries and onion rings. The fish and chips are also very good. If you like burgers you have numerous choices and they don't  hurry you out

Went during lunch time and the place wasn't that busy.  Was seated right away and given a menu.  The waitress appeared within a reasonable amount of time to take my order, which was the peppercorn burger and a diet coke.  When my food came, I reached for the ketchup bottle on the table, only to find that it was empty.  I finally saw the hostess seating another party and asked her for a new ketchup bottle, which she gave me from an empty table. The burger was prepared as ordered, but what would have made it better would have been if the bun was lightly toasted.  The soft bun really didn't go with the hearty burger.  Overall it was Ok.  I asked for more fries and they came pretty quickly.
Great place to get a burger . Many to choose from. Great service !!!! Was going to go to the diner to get a Burger was on my way back from the mall saw Red Robin stopped and glad I did !!!!

This was the first time ever at a Red Robins.  I arrived a solid thirty minutes before my party arrived.  Instead of sitting alone at the bar and twiddling my thumbs over a cold drink, the hostess immediately seated me.  Within seconds Tiffany, my Irish waitress, stood next to me and started up a conversation.  After a few minutes, I told her I'm sorry my party hasn't arrived yet, but will soon.  Her response was "I know.  The hostess told me.  I just wanted to keep you company for a few minutes before they get here." She is an amazing waitress for that and knowing everything on the menu like the back of her hand. The food was exactly what I though ti would be...delicious!  The bar menu is extensive and reasonably priced.

This place has been steadily going downhill for awhile. You used to have to wait to get in. Now you walk right to a table. It's a haven for families and smelled like urine this evening. While the smell was new, the shift towards children is not so if you're not a fan of that sort of thing, skip this Red Robin's.  The steak fries are straightforward. They still give you unlimited ones with your burger, and the special seasoning remains on the table. I've gotten a salad or veggie burger in the past but tonight I opted for a meat burger. It had guacamole, bacon, cheese, lettuce, onions, and tomatoes. I was expecting a hearty, oozy, carnivorous feast. Instead, it tasted like nothing until I hit a bacon shard.  Not worth the calories at all. I ended up leaving half the bun and just eating the unexceptional patty. My diet soda was bitter like they didn't put enough syrup into the machine. My partner said his Peppercorn burger was good. Not the best one ever but not awful. Our bill for two burgers and two sodas was $26 before tip so that's a plus - it is economical. Service was good, too.  However, you can get a better, bigger, fresher burger down the street at the Tick Tock diner for the same price. The fries aren't unlimited there but we didn't bother with a second helping anyway. I will not be returning here.

I can't tell you how many times I've been here. I've tried: Banzai burger (4/5), Prim rib dip (5/5),  and my all time favorite one... Wild West Buffalo Burger. It tastes just like beef but w/o all the fat. This burger only come with the regular steak fries so I always ask if they can make it with the parmasian garlic steak fries and I never have a problem. And the best drink is the Freckled Lemonade. It's bottomless so refill all you want!!!

So last night we try to watch the super bowl and get some burgers. After ordering the food I saw a mouse under one the tables. I let the waiter know about it but it looked very normal to him and he didn't do anything about the mouse. I think this place is super dirty and shouldn't be allowed to be open.

Excellent! My husband loves burgers and this was a last minute decision to go there after a movie. My husband ordered the pigged out burger which he thought was great. It comes with bottomless steak fries which was a plus. On every table they have a shaker of Red Robin Seasoning for your fries and salads that was excellent!  We shared an order of mozzarella sticks as an appetizer ( which btw was only $2.99!!!) and I had the French onion soup and a cobb salad. The Cobb salad was one of the best cobb salads I have had in a really long time. The serving size was huge! I also had a bowl of French onion soup that was pretty good. The one thing I will say is that the French onion soup did not look like the picture of it online and was thrown together. For the price of a bowl of FO soup that's $6.00 it could of looked a little nicer when it was served. It tasted great but I expected something a little more like the picture online for The price I paid... The server was one of the nicest servers I ever had! All around good meal out

My first time here.  Not a bad place to bring the kids. My mushroom burger was ok. The burger (meat) did not really blow me away. I guess I was expecting a thicker, juicy burger.  I did like that they offer a few types of buns to choose from. reasonably priced.

Good place for a burger, which come with bottomless fries, dusted with some seasoning and salt.  There are a decent variety of burgers to choose from, any of which can be replaced with a turkey or vegetable burger.  Service can be spotty, but not a big problem. I haven't tried any of the other items from the appetizer, salads, or sandwich categories though.  We go there for one thing and one thing only...burgers.  Oh, and bottomless fries.  :-)
The burger with the fried egg was my favorite. Yes, was! I don't eat beef anymore so its just a great memory. The freckled lemonade is unmatched!! The bottomless fries arent bad either.

Friendly service, with REALLY UNIMPRESSIVE food.  It was empty on a Saturday night, indicative of its reputation amongst the locals.  I ended up getting a $25 gift certificate thanks to a subpar meal.  They couldn't get a margarita right after two tries and no other drink orders (and I mean none of the other 4 tables in the restaurant were asking for a drink from the bar man) to mess with his concentration.   Our server was very friendly and the manager who responded to my complaint was very kind.  In the interest of honest reviewing, I won't be bought by a $25 GC.  I will say that I MIGHT go back, but I'll say that I used my GC at a NY location.  The good service gives me hope that they might have improved...

This place didn't seem to have any management present.  It's run by a bunch of high school kids that lack any leadership.  very similar to the restaurant Shenanigans from the movie Waiting.  The burger made me sick the whole night, i can only imagine how it was cooked and handled.  Never going back

Got here at 9:40 pm ordered drinks about 5 minutes later and was told that the bar was now closed.  At 9:45 on St Patrick's Day?  We told the waitress right when she told us this can we just go ahead and order our second round now and she checked with the two (yes 2) people behind the bar and they said no.  I don't get this - the restaurant is open, we were seated, could still order food and there were people at the bar and behind the bar.  We came here because they have drinks - I would thing again before coming back.
Go elsewhere! Bathrooms are nasty, no paper towels, booth we sat on had crap on the seats, and no one to greet you at the door. Piss poor!

Arrived with a party of 9. We ordered entree's, apps and bottomless fries. After an hour we only received 2 baskets of fries. After an hour and a half we got our apps, only after all of our drinks were finished and sitting empty for over 20min. The waitress Tiffany was MIA for most of the time and only cleared our table after it was overflowing and we prompted her to.  It didn't meet even the basic standards for a fast food chain and the bar isn't high to begin with.

When I crave a greasy burger from a chain?  Red Robin is where you'll probably find me.   My favorite thing about RR, other than the fact that they'll bring you a basket of unlimited fries as an appetizer, is that they'll customize everything.  No mayo, no butter, awesome.   Second favorite thing?  They have buffalo meat!!  In a slight attempt to still keep an eye out on what I'm eating, I always choose buffalo meat whenever it's offered (yes, even with a basket of fries lol).  Theirs is always pretty good.   Third?  The banzai burger!! Terikayi and pineapple on a burger are heaven.  Pair that with a buffalo patty instead of beef, no mayo & no butter on the bun...and you have yourself a happy girl right here.   Service has always been great, which I hate to admit always surprises me.  Never wait for more than a minute when we ask for something.

Have been seeing that stupid stick in your brain commercial!! Looked it up on google  and could not find one close in NJ. So we stayed at the La Quinta in Clifton NJ for a swim break and well hello it was attached. The food is cheap. The place is clean. The food is fatty. You get large portions and fast service. Only complaint the cheese was like rubber because it basked to long under the heating lamp while waiting for our server to deliver to  our table. Other than that., It's great drunk food.  They don't skimp on the alcohol drinks. My Jd and diet coke was STRONG!!!! They deliver to your hotel room not your home!

Obscure location but awesome place. Been wanting to get my red robin fix on for a while and finally took the opportunity to go. Since they had their Oktoberfest burger for a limited time, I had to get it and it was ver good, liked the pretzel bun! Next time back I'll if definitely get the a1 peppercorn ; ) And guess what...... Steak fries!!

Excellent Teriyaki chicken burger and Banzai Salad. Also great selection of drinks including their Freckled Lemonade, a mix of lemonade, fresh strawberries, and strawberry syrup. Nice atmosphere as well. Not a bad choice for a casual family dinner.

I don't care if they "just opened a month ago". The manager who claims to have opened dozens of restaurants should KNOW BETTER.  If he is experienced he would know they AREN'T READY!!!   Service?  Like a 3 ring circus.  The food?  How do you screw up a burger and rings???  If you aren't fully prepared to operate as a restaurant, do not open.  You will lose customers forever.  We will not return, just like our waiter never returned with the rest of our meal!!!!  Too many other places and options.
I love their bugers. Great bar area and atmosphere. Good beers. Good prices.

How long does it take to make 5 burgers at 10pm?  Apparently it takes 20-30 minutes.  We ordered the chips with salsa and guacamole, but the amount of guac was pretty sad, it came in the little 2oz sauce cups that wasn't even half filled.  The burgers were OK for the most part, but the fries were no longer fresh.
I went there to have dinner with my son and my boyfriend. The waiter seemed very rush. She had too many tables and couldn't be attentive. The food also came out very late.

So after the last terrible lunch we had here and only because Andres was generous enough to take care of our meals this time had i said okay to coming back to this  location. We where seated right away and the resturant was not by any standards packed no one at the bar or no crowd considering the game was about to start but having said that maybe its because of the service . We where looking over or menus and our waitress came over and asked of we where ready to order . I asked for a sam adams and my wife got an angry orchard and 2 waters an a wedge salad for my wife and 2 burgers. It took 22 mins to get our waters WATERS ! By the time our beers were brought to the table our glasses where no longer frosted nor was my beer really that cold. At this point we have waited another 15 mins an the waitress comes over and say she is really sorry about the wait but either they lost our ticket or the order was never placed and she spoke to the manager and he was "pushing our order thru" The manager at this point should have come over an spoke to us but he didn't . My wifes salad finally came out with no dressing and we had to ask for it .  Because everything was so late my wife could not finish her salad before our burgers where on our table . There was a table of 4 who came in after us ate and paid before we where done .  So as we where finishing up we saw someone  who looked to be a manger and asked if he was and he said yes he was so we started to explain or terrible time here not just this time but the time before this visit and he said he knew our order was delayed for whatever reason because his server told him IF YOU KNEW WHY WOULDN'T YOU COME OVER AFTER WE ATE TO AT LEAST SAY SOMETHING TO US! He told me that we could keep the gift card that we already had been given from corporate because of terrible service last time . I will never set off into this location again with all the burger place that are popping ip all over the place you would think that you might want to make sure your service stands out above others. This used to be a great spot for lunch but id rather stay home and have a PB&J then have horrible service

Red Robin on rt.3 is one of my food staples. I come here atleast a couple times a month. The service is usually pretty good, and the burgers are great. Most of them come with unlimited steak fries, all for around 10-12 bucks depending on the burger you get. Sometimes, they get skimpy with the fries refill but that's most likely because they get quite busy and backed up. Other than that, no complaints, better than your average burger joint!
