I was so looking forward to dinner at Red Robin in Paramus but when we got there they weren't open yet so we went to the one in Clifton and what I got was so disappointing. It took forever to get seated, even longer to get our food and then the food wasn't very good. Don't waste your time.

I love burgers. Period. So why wouldn't I love this place? Honestly, I usually skip most of the fancy burgers and order the bison or turkey burger. I find that the more I try to add or change - no cheese, medium well, etc - the more mixed up the order arrives. I keep it simple and order the grilled turkey burger nowadays, which is (usually always) absolutely delicious. The best part: chipotle mayo. *sigh. I might ask for some on the side just to send it off for analysis. Really. I know everyone loves the unlimited fries but I've never cared for them here, oddly enough. I LOVE that they now allow side substitutions - I get the coleslaw or side salad with ranch. I'm tempted to ask for the melon but am scared to find out what type of melon Red Robin has lying around? I can't imagine many people ask for it. My complaint: what happened to the spinach and artichoke dip?? It used to be thick, stick-to-your-chip ridiculous good. Now, it's thin, runny and smells funny. I'm not sure what happened to the recipe, but it's awful. I'll never order it again and it sadly used to be one of my favorite starters anywhere. This was one of the few times I've ever ordered something and didn't eat it after just a few bites. Yuck. :P Sure - the place sometimes could use some extra cleaning. The women's restroom on weekends looks like it was hit by a hurricane. It goes without saying - lots of kids if you don't sit by the bar. Service is pretty good - lots of young servers - but am I the only one a little annoyed that you don't get 5 minutes to eat your appetizer before your burger arrives?  Red Robin: bring back the dip please!!

I am a staunch, anti-chain restaurant person. But my boyfriend kept insisting we go merely because of the bottomless fries. We checked the online menu, and it said they'd substitute any of the burger concepts with either a Gardenburger or Vegan Boca burger, so I was actually kind of sold. This is a really decent chain restaurant, no lie. Places like Applebees, Chilli's, Fridays, etc. have AWFUL vegetarian options - this place at least tries to mask the usual veg burger with some cool options. Even the chicken sandwich options could be replaced with a veg burger.  So I got the guacamole "garden"burger - sans swiss or bacon - and it was really good! My boyfriend and I love to get a run for our money so we got our basket of fries filled like three times each - how many bags of fries must that be?! I ate half my sandwich, and had lunch the next day.  Our waitress kept trying to avoid us because she knew we were fry-thieves, but whatever, the menu was plastered with the fact that they have bottomless fries. Take advantage! For both of us, it came to, literally, $20 bucks. It's such a good deal. I actually liked my food. It was a chain restaurant miracle! I totally recommend it.

I went several years ago and had high hopes for this chain.  My father had a free birthday meal so we went with it.  From start to finish completely disappointed.  The food was sub par.   I had a chicken salad (the order was wrong) and my dad had a burger and fries.  Fries were good for frozen food section fries.  The server made fun of my salad choice, did not bring out our food and then we couldn't find him for 45 minutes.  The manager had to cater to our water needs.  Leaving took some time as well.  Overall, the service and quality of food was very disappointing.  I'm sure people will continue to go there but for my experience, not positive.

A few weeks back, the wife and I went for lunch. We waited about 15 mins, which shouldn't have been considering how many empty tables there were. We got seated and waited for the server. He finally shows up 10 mins later and we tell him we would like glasses of water. He runs off. Returns about 5 mins after with the water, but turns and runs off without taking our order. Another 15 mins passes and he finally takes our order. We waited another 45 mins for our food, in which time he only went to the kitchen once. He was busier with the bar. We got up, put on our coats and walked out without being approached by any staff member. Never again. We ate elsewhere.
My fave burgers after Five Guys. Get the Royal Red Robin buger (It has  fried Egg inside) with chipotle mayo. The mozzarella sticks are amazing. Great customer service and great food.

Always get take out.  I can definitely see that the service is terrible though.  The location is pretty bad too.  Thea, the host, is wonderful and accommodating.  The burgers are delicious.  The french onion soup was the worst french onion soup i ever had.  I come here for the burgers and Thea's service.  Other than that it looks like no one cares.

We sat at the bar area and ordered off their happy hour menu.  3 dollar drafts - 5 dollar jumpstarters.  The server in the bar area was very attentive and eager to please.  Burgers were cooked to perfection that I ate it ALL!  Also the onion rings were on point.  Overheard someone saying that  management was being changed during dinner so that could have been why it took a while to get seated but other than that I was happy little camper!

BEST place for a burger!  I never knew this place even exsisted because it's semi-hidden by the hotel next door, but I'm soooo glad I came! I had the the classic red robin burger with the egg, bacon and 3 lbs of lard probably...it's delicious.  They also have great, crispy fries and they provide you with your own seasoning container to add as much as you'd like.  My friend literally tried to five finger discount the seasoning because it got so addictive!   The service is great, there was not much of a wait like other chain restaurants in the area and price is average.   I know a previous review was complaining about how you can only really get burgers here...but what do you expect from a place who's menu includes a "pot roast" burger??  It does remind me of the Rutgers Grease trucks, and that's probably why I love it a little bit more.   Hit up Red Robin before a night full of dancing so you don't feel too guilty about the 3,000 calories you're probably going to inhale.

I went here once because I was told that it was a decent place to try a new take on an old favorite. They were definitely correct! The food is pretty good, at least what I tried. I'm really not sure how one rights up a burger chain though.  The only issue I had when I went there was the place was absolutely filthy. The table they sat us at wasn't cleaned from the last customers. The worst part is that it didn't seem to be too crowded. That's what you get for doing something on a Friday or Saturday night.  Hopefully things have gotten straightened out, but I would recommend this place!
Hunk a burning love burger was very decent. Bottomless fries and an excellent martini. Hard to complain.

I don't normally review chains, but Red Robin is unique to our area. Not everyone has heard of it, and this location is the only one nearby.  Of course everyone loves the burgers, but the turkey burgers are really good too. It's one of the best I've had dining out., to be honest. And you can substitute turkey or veggie burgers for pretty much any of the regular burgers on the menu. My fave is the one that's like a rueben, on rye bread with sauerkraut. I think it's called the All-American or something like that. Plus the endless fry thing is pretty cool. Ask for a basket after you order, but before you receive your burger. Just something to munch on without having to order an app.  Next time I go back, I want to try the Bailey's Irish Cream Milkshake. Enjoy!

I've been wanting to try Red Robin since that damn catchy jingle invaded my TV years ago...so Saturday night, my boyfriend and I decided to check this one out. Being that it was a Saturday, we clearly had to wait 20 min to get a table, no big deal. When we were seated, we needed a few min before we ordered, which we were given. Once our waiter returned, we ordered our drinks, appetizers and burgers (including how we wanted them done), along with the dipping sauces for our fries. The waiter wrote nothing down which usually impresses me but in this case I was concerned that he'd forget something. 20 minutes later we got our appetizer (the spinach artichoke dip, which was actually pretty good despite the measly portion), and 15 minutes after we were done they still hadn't cleared the table. It was only when they brought our burgers out that they asked if we wanted the plate removed (uh, duh! It was empty and what were we gonna do with it??). For entrées, I got the Big Tavern burger and my boyfriend got the Royal Red Robin burger. He loooved his, but mine was just okay. I was expecting this fantastic "special" tavern sauce, but there was barely any on it, so it tasted like a pretty average burger (plus it wasn't THAT big). I'd asked for my burger to have no pink (aka well done) and there was pink. Our waiter also forgot one of our dipping sauces not once, but twice. He actually never brought it out...And my final complaint is that we were never asked if we wanted another drink or given water or anything. So we sat there parched for another 20 minutes before anyone came by to ask if we needed anything else, at which point we just asked for the check.  Bottom line, I'm pretty easy to please, and I'm usually pretty laid back when it comes to service, but this whole experience was very disappointing to me, which should actually say a LOT. I don't know if we'll be coming back here again...

Red robin has great onion rings and burgers. Our meal included bottomless fries and drink refills. The service was fine (thanks Jen) and the atmosphere was fun. But....the bathroom was gross, not clean at all. The floor was sticky and paper all over the place. Our table was slightly sticky as well. Would have added another star if the place was cleaner.
Thick and juicy burger! But I'm on a mission to find the best burger between: *  Red Robin *  Zinburger *  Smashburger *  5 Guys Burger

The burgers are tremendous, however the service is mediocre. Which ultimately leaves me undecided. You will have to judge for yourself. Cocktails are excellent as well, be mindful not to have the cocktails alter your final decision.

Ok so there are no Red Robin restaurants in the five boroughs of New York nor do they have any branches out in LI... so while driving by in Jersey, we decided to do lunch here. It's real close to the gas station right off the highway and in front of a hotel. Always see their commercials on TV and glad we stopped by. I would recommend the following: Towering Onion Rings - Yummy fried goodness of onion rings on a tower to share! The dips that come with are pretty good too. Chicken Sandwich - Don't think you can go wrong with any of the chicken sandwiches. Personal faves are Teriyaki Chicken Sandwich (because I love pineapples!) and Chicken Caprese Sandwich (comes on ciabatta bread with pesto sauce).  Also, any of the burgers and sandwiches come with endless steak fries which is a total plus if you feel like pigging out! If you order one of their special burgers/sandwiches, you can also get garlic fries. Mountain High Mudd Pie - is a MUST to share!! I duno how the pie looks like as a whole but just having a slice is huge. If you love chocolate ice cream with crunchies, you MUST have this...  Very large selection of non-alcohoIic drinks which include my fave Mango Bango Limeade.  For a fast food chain restaurant, they have a good variety of sandwiches and burgers that will satisfy the pickiest of the bunch. I would def. come back.

Will travel for food Finally found the only Red Robin in the Tri-State Area!!  Forced someone w/ a car to take me. Got lost -took us two hours to get here.  What's up w/ Jersey and their fucked up signs?! You think you've followed the correct one, turns out it was the OTHER fork in the road a few miles back. WTF!?  Anyway, we were in serious cow-land. Everyone in the car was pissed off.  Me and my big fucking ideas.... but it was all rainbows and butterflies once we got there. Everyone loved their junky-ass food. DO NOT HATE until you try their spinach n artichoke dip, and the Red Robin burger w/ bacon, cheese, and fried egg (Just look at my picture please!) -2 stars for the fucked up location
This red robin is a regular chain restaurant. I go here only to have a particular burger and watch football games. The portion sizes are pretty huge and their specials are very good.
Unlimited fries.  Unlimited fries!  And the burgers are pretty tasty too!  Wish I didn't have to drive so far to go, but this is the only one I know of that doesn't have horrid reviews.

I was tired of looking at the Red Robin banner ads all over my websites, and decided it was time to pay them a visit (plus the promise of unlimited fries didn't hurt either). First off, Google Maps is WRONG.  They sent us into a residential area which added an additional 30 minutes to our 1hr+ journey.  Please double check directions before you hop in the car.  Don't expect your GPS to  be correct all the time! When we got there we were greeted with an enthusiastic wait staff.  They sat me and my 3 friends down immediately and presented us with menus.  They asked if it was our first time there (in which we stated our travel time) and gave us some recommendations. We started off with the tower of onion rings which was stacked tall.  It was also amazing and delicious (and can easily give Outback's Onion Blossom a run for its money). Between the 4 of us we ordered 7 entrees (because we were planning on taking home leftovers, not because we eat like savage animals). The service was fast, and they didn't rush us at all or overwhelmed us with having all the plates arriving at the same time. The manager came around not once, but twice to ask how everything was, and sat with us to give a history of Red Robin, and his gratitude for making the journey over. The drinks were absolutely delicious and the fact that it was indeed free-refills was MIND BLOWING.  There was no way you can get these drinks in Times Square with free refills.  For the 2.5 hours we were there, we must have had 8 refills each (because we all had to pee by the time we got home). We ended the meal with their famous mud pie and a handful of their employees singing happy birthday to us (even though it was not anyone's birthday), but to show just how happy they were to have us there. Needless to say when I got home, my friends all fought over the leftovers, leaving me wondering when the next time we would go on another foodventure to Red Robin again...

Went in last evening 12/11/12..it was a Tuesday so maybe that was the excuse for the 15-20 minute wait before even being acknowledged. Where were the waiters? I asked another party who came in and wondered the same thing. In any event, the burger was excellent. If you don't mind slow service, then indulge. Thank goodness the burgers are awesome. Managers, take note.....hence the 3 stars instead of 5.

my first time at a red robin!  well, i only tried the okotberfest burger and their tower of onion rings.  i'm a fan of anything on a pretzel bun... so, i was sold w/the pretzel bun burger (coulda done w/out the ham though...)  sadly, the french fries are the huge wedge type...  im more of a crispy fry kinda gal. onion rings were great.. only one thing that kinda soured the entire experience.  we mistakenly ordered a tower of onion rings (not knowing that there was a smaller single serving portion).  we literally chased our waitress down less than a minute later to correct our order..  all she did was  tell us she already put the order in the computer and that was that.  gees, give me a break.  i could understand if we had waited 5-10 minutes later to change our order... but, less than a minute?  you and i both know that our onion rings werent being made yet... and if they were = pre madeeeee.  if thats the case, swallow the $7 and get rid of such a ridiculous rule.   all in all, i liked the burger and onion rings.  just not the restaurants strict rules.

Ignoring the fact that it's completely unhealthy, their burgers are sooo good! They only give you two choices for how you want it cooked (little pink or no pink) but i've never been disappointed! their seasoning is awesome on fries! Love that you can get a burger wrapped in lettuce or on a multigrain bun!

Eh, burger is OK... It's what you would expect from a chain. However, the seasoned bottomless fries and strawberry speckled lemonade are the reasons I keep coming back! Plus, its a must stop before/after the movies. It's one of the few restaurants in the Clifton Commons area that you generally won't have a long wait if any on the weekends.
Good burgers considering it's a chain. Be sure to ask if there are any specials...goo dseasoing for  your fries etc...

My daughter loves this place and their lunches are very well done. The burgers are well seasoned and huge and come with all the fries you can consume in a lunch or dinner. Service is friendly and the desserts are also very well made and delicious. It's really a treat to dine there if you want to put on a few pounds.

This place gets five stars!! Their burgers are simply heavenly. I mean I die and go straight to heaven when I bit into one!! SOOO delish!! They give you endless fries, but might forget to tell you that so make sure you order extra for the able... they're free!! I really loved the Five-Alarm Burger & Guacamole Cheese Burger. OMG AWESOME!! The wait staff is alittle scattered, but you're there for the burgers not the service!! They also have a full bar too so you can get blasted and stuffed at the same time! PERFECT! Just don't expect a low calorie dinner here, this WILL completely destroy a girl's diet! But, it's so worth it!!! Oh, sometimes parking can be horrible depending on the time you go.. be weary.. P.S. be sure to order the Onion Rings for appetizer.. they come on a skewer, they are big huge and over the top! Just the way I like it!
Surprisingly delicious burgers for a chain restaurant. Looking forward to returning.

The wife and I went in for a burger the other night that and I am happy to report that the corporate management has heeded the calls from their customers and added the Steak Sliders to their regular menu! Needless to say, I left a happy camper. I would also encourage everyone to sign up for their frequent flier's club. You'll get a coupon for a free burger on your B-days and  the occasional  other kool deal offers but they do not inundate you with emails.

Food looks good, customers were cool, got along great with the co-workers; the managers? bastards. Absolute bastards. I moved here to North Jersey without a job and looking for serving work; was doing training for a week then paperwork for another week, then I get evaluated for waiter work. I process everything right, got along with my customers and on my 2ND EVALUATION! a customer recommended me to the managers. What happens? The managers let me go all because I didnt greet a table in the right time and because a table liked me alot and wanted to get to know me. My damn luck. Well I have a BA in Film Production soooo I should concentrate on that!

My favorite burger spot in Jersey.  My coworkers made it a habit to come here every week to eat, and always worth it.  The burgers are soooo good, and bottomless fries, although the food is really fulling so I usually don't go for seconds. The milkshake is pretty good too,.

not a bad food experience, just glacial service. why do managers in these places act like the A/V nerds from High School? Poor waitress was slammed, and the 20 something pimple pillow was totally helpless to give a hand.....  Too busy playing with his retractable key chain......
One of the waiters was rood !! if she gonna be there next time I'll not eat there xD
If you are in the mood for some sinful friend food this is your place.  Delicious apps and burgers.

The burgers are great here . The staff is also very attentive and accommodating . Well we have twins newborn boys and like a hummer for a stroller. They always put us in a gd spot not to be disturbed.

I really like the burgers at Red Robin.  Very succulent and great texture. The portions are big and the endless drinks and fries make a meal here a great deal. The waiter was a little bit inattentive to us while we were trying to get the check and the food took REALLY long to come.  Other than that, comig here is totally worth the long wait time.  Sucks though if you're starving and all you can do is stare at the plates of food passing you by, hoping it's yours.

well it was 10.00pm and I needed something.  Great service, like i was the first customer of the night not the last.  Fish and chips, batter not good but then it never is anywhere, fish inside good. Steak fries good.  Server suggested a scoop of icecream and fudge sauce -small portion just to tide me over that sugar fix and she was right.  Sometimes the overall experience is more important than just the food.  Two glasses wine, fish and chips, ice cream pud..$27.  Good VFM and zero attitude
Reddddd Robbbinnn.... Yummm.... Always great friendly customer service. Just add perks to the amazing burgers and bottomless fries! Freckled lemonade is AMAZING and also bottomless.

Ah yes, another "chain gang" member in the ever suffocating pile of non-original restaurants.  I swear if NJ had a "Rum Runners", I would so go there when craving meat, as opposed to the other double-R'd restaurant.  However, this place had to stand-in. On a Saturday night, this place was packed.  However, we managed to be seated quickly.  The service was excellent.  The food was pretty dang good.  For a chain member that is. The prices were pretty decent too.

It's inexcusable how horrible this place is. My family went here last night.  I ordered the honest hummus plate, which, apparently, just comes with a with a cup of hummus, a few carrots, and a slice of pickle.   I also ordered sweet potato fries which were cold and had a hair in them.  I don't want to know what goes on in their kitchen.  I am thoroughly disgusted and through with this place.  My family wasn't impressed either.  My mother said her food was only decent and missing some of it's components.  Stay away from here.

Seen a few reviews either negative or leaning that way and thought I would weigh in. My wife and I have been here twice in the last 6 months and both times the food and the service exceeded expectations. We are both Viet Nam era veterans and intend to dine here tonight, 11/11/2013, to take advantage of the free veterans day entrees. We used to go to Applebee's on Veterans' Day, but they have never made amends for the Chelsea Welch incident.

I love the chill, casual atmosphere of this place.  It's kind of like a slightly more upscale Fuddruckers with table service.  The menu is mostly tasty burgers (and you can sub turkey or veggie burgers for all of them) with some chicken sandwiches, salads, and pasta thrown in for variety.  My favorites are the chicken sandwich with BBQ sauce and fried onion strings, and the burger with swiss and mushrooms.  They also have a nice selection of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks.  Sometimes the service here is completely amazing, and sometimes it's middle of the road... last time we went was one of the awesome times.  Even after we had paid the bill and we sat around talking for awhile, the waiter still came by to check if we needed any drink refills or anything.  Truly rare in the world of chains...
The food here is great, but the bottomless root beer float was not bottomless, and I wasn't told until after I had 2. The food is still good, but watch out what you order!

From the time we walked in I should have realized this experience would be pretty bad! A family member has an allergy a special menu was brought to the table but the food was not handled properly and this person got sick.  The server was rude maybe if she listened properly she would have gotten everything right.  The iced tea so strong I couldn't drink it and when I asked for a replacement she never brought one.  There are better places on the other side of Route 3 I recommend you visit one.  At this rate the Clifton location needs better management and staff these people are too young to handle their jobs! Customer service sells not rudeness!
They have the best burgers out of any chain! You must come and eat at Red Robin.

This was the first red robin I went to, and was the only one in the area at the time. I was initially impressed and really was pleased with everything. After the location in Rockaway opened it seems like this one has gotten worse. On my last visit with some out of town friends who had never visited a red robin there was a wait to get in, and I let that add to the hype for them. Once we were seated it was a totally different ballgame. The server/bartender rang up the wrong appetizer and the poor runner took the heat for bringing us the wrong food. Once we were finished (2 hours, no wonder there was a wait) we saw the bill had the wrong appetizer that initially came over and laughed it off. We ended up being served by a couple different people, and our original server/bartender was a trainwreck. the game for us became predicting the next time dishes would break. It must have happened 4 times during our visit. Drinks started coming out in the wrong glassware, I even witnessed a server pour more ice in the same glass for a refill. A huge fall from grace. I hope for the restaurants sake that the staff has been fixed in the last year, because I KNOW the food is good, but they just couldn't handle the workload on this night
It was very convenient being attached to the hotel I was at.  The food was good, service was quick, and the prices were reasonable.

It takes me about an hour of bad traffic and 18 miles to get to this spot but it is really worth it, best burger spot I know so far, i usually go for the traditional Red Robin Bacon Cheeseburger and that is all i need to be happy.. service is great, everyone is very attentive and the environment is nice and quiet, good for a family thing or a nice date...I cant really point out anything wrong with this place, even their prices keep you happy at the end of the meal. Two thumbs up!

Fast casual restaurants seem to come down to one core menu theme: make it SWEET.  Red Robin, thank God, knows to do the other thing: make it SAVORY.  Delicious burgers, certainly exceeding the current fad standard of gourmet hamburgers.  Plus you get a sit-down, full bar, decent salads and apps, etc.  This location has friendly, efficient service (despite being PACKED every time I've been there) and a cheerful set of rooms.  There should be more RR's in the NY Metro Area!

I was seated in a dark area with my family for 15 min.  No waiter no service at all. Then I went back up to the girls up in the front of the restaurant an ask to be moved. Mind you she was texting, looking around to see if she had space. The restaurant was more then half empty.she told me to give her three mins. Then I waited while her an another girl there were chatting away. 15 more min passed an she never came over to move me. So I was forgotten about. My first was amazing that's why I went back but just because of the girl not giving two shits about the red robin brand don't think i'll go back. I only took the time to right this is because customer service is a job not to be ignored. It speaks for itself.

What started out as a pleasant experience (sweet waitress, nice staff, ok food) at Red Robin turned out to be the biggest nightmare. I had the most horrific experience at this location. After being bullied, berated, and humiliated by the supposed manager on site over a coupon (he had on a discolored blue polo and no name tag and told me he wasnt the manager and the waitress was wrong) I stopped talking to him and requested his name because i'd was going to share my experience to corporate. This is one of the few chain restaurants that I really enjoy and often go to. They have a very nice selection of burgers, good service and alcohol. The price is reasonable (not great but not terrible) and right in range with every other food chain out there (Fridays, Chilis, etc). The place is always packed on prime eating days, too, so I guess that means lots of people like it.
reasonably priced burgers.  food much better than other chain restaurants. decent bar area.

I went here on February 23rd. I was initially excited to come because it's been about 6the months since I've been there. My husband and I showed up at about 8:45pm and ut only took a few minutes to be seated. We were sitting there for over 20a minutes a a server never showed up to take our order. After 20another minutes we flagged down a manager to place our order. We were STARVING so we decided to order nachos as a quick appetizer. Finally all of our food came out at the same time. The machos were cold and no cheese on these. We complained to the food runner and these were taken off our bill. Then we had to find napkins and silverware because we still hadn't seen our server. Then the fire alarm goes off. Loud bells and flashing lights! Magically our server shows up to drop our check. I can't believe I paid for that horrendous meal. The compliant was just another example of poor customer service. I can get a burger a million places. This place has gone downhill and I can't return.

I really dont understand whats so great about this place according to the reviews. my waitress started off good, but then basically disappeared for like half an hour and became uninterested with us. the fries were okay. i got a bacon gaucamole burger. the burger was kind bland
